intro: Stegitris algarviensis, commonly known as the Algarve starwort, is a rare flowering plant native to the Algarve region of southern Portugal. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its small, star-shaped blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in coastal environments. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and is known for its delicate appearance. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
